artist: Jamie Okuma; Designer: Shoes designed by Christian Louboutin
creditline: Bequest of Virginia Doneghy, by exchange
dimension: 8 5/8 x 9 3/16 x 3 1/4 in. (21.91 x 23.34 x 8.26 cm) (object part, each)
life_date: Jamie Okuma, Luiseño and Shoshone–Bannock, born 1977; Shoes designed by Christian Louboutin, Designer, French, born 1963
medium: Leather, glass beads, porcupine quills, sterling silver cones, brass sequins, chicken feathers, cloth, deer rawhide, buckskin
text: Award winning artist Jamie Okuma has applied a Native American aesthetic to a pair of Christian Louboutin stilettos.  Meticulously beaded and quilled, they are a contemporary version of highly decorated moccasins. Okuma researches historic artwork but updates the aesthetic to appeal to contemporary Native tastes and concerns.
title: Adaptation II
